News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Q3FY26 Results: Revenue Up 38.6% YoY
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem reported strong Q3FY26 consolidated revenue of ₹128,875.74 lakhs, up 38.6% YoY. Net profit surged to ₹14,511.45 lakhs vs ₹3,114.46 lakhs in Q3FY25. Board declared interim dividend of ₹6 per share.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Board Meet Set for Jan 29, 2026
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem Limited has scheduled its Board meeting for January 29, 2026, to consider Q3FY26 unaudited financial results and potential interim dividend declaration.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Raises FY26 Margin and Revenue Growth Guidance
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem has increased its FY26 margin guidance to 18-20% from the previous 15-18% range and raised its revenue growth forecast from 15% to 20%. The upward revision in financial projections indicates improved business outlook and operational efficiency expectations for the agrochemical company.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Reports 20% Revenue Growth to INR 929 Crores in Q2 with Strong Volume Recovery
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem Limited reported total revenue of INR 929 crores in Q2, representing 20% year-on-year growth driven by 35% overall volume growth. The agrochemical segment grew 27% to INR 803 crores while non-agrochemical business declined 11% to INR 126 crores. Gross margins expanded significantly by 690 basis points to 34.5% due to input cost stabilization. EBITDA increased 71% to INR 139 crores with margins at 15%, while PAT grew 75% to INR 74 crores. For H1, revenue reached INR 1,914 crores (23% growth) with PAT of INR 217 crores (212% growth). The company maintains 2,994 product registrations globally with 1,068 applications pending approval. Working capital days improved to 84 days from 118 days in March 2025. Management expects EBITDA margins of 15-18% for the full year and plans capex of INR 450-500 crores. The company remains debt-free with cash and liquid investments of INR 794 crores.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Targets 15-18% EBITDA Margins for FY26
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem's Managing Director has confirmed that the company expects to maintain healthy EBITDA margins in the range of 15-18% for FY26.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Reports Strong Q2 Growth with Revenue Up 19% and Net Profit Nearly Doubling
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem delivered robust quarterly performance with revenue rising to 9.3 billion rupees from 7.8 billion rupees in the same period last year. The company's consolidated net profit surged to 743 million rupees compared to 420 million rupees year-over-year. EBITDA increased to 1.33 billion rupees from 1 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin improved to 14.30% from 12.96% in the corresponding quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Schedules Conference Call to Discuss 2Q & 1HFY26 Earnings
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem Limited has scheduled a conference call for analysts and investors on Friday, October 31, 2025 at 12:30 P.M. IST to discuss its 2Q & 1HFY26 earnings results. The call will be hosted by Antique Stock Broking Limited and will feature senior management including Chairman & Managing Director Mr. Ramprakash V. Bubna, CFO Mr. Shailesh Mehendale, and Company Secretary Mr. Jetkin Gudhka. The company has provided dial-in details for participants from multiple countries including India, US, UK, and other international locations.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Targets Over 18% EBITDA Margins in FY26 on Stable Market Conditions
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem expects to achieve EBITDA margins exceeding 18% in FY26, driven by improving pricing trends, stable euro-dollar exchange rates, and operational efficiencies. Chairman and Managing Director Ramprakash V Bubna stated that concerns regarding pricing, volume, and destocking pressures from the past two years have stabilized, with global inventory levels returning to normal. The company logged strong growth in the first quarter and expects momentum to continue. Sharda Cropchem's business performance is significantly impacted by euro-dollar exchange rates, as 95% of sourcing is from China in dollars while majority sales are in Europe. The company does not expect Trump's tariffs to hurt business due to strict US government approval requirements for their products, allowing them to pass tariff increases to customers. The company holds approximately Rs 790 crore in cash and cash equivalents with no immediate acquisition plans, though it doubled dividends in FY25 and may consider further increases.

News.Title: Sharda Crop Shares Audio Recording of Q1 FY 2025-26 Earnings Conference Call
News.Summary: Sharda Crop has made available the audio recording of its Q1 FY 2025-26 earnings conference call with analysts and investors. The call was conducted digitally on July 25, 2025, at 5:30 PM IST. The company has provided a Google Drive link to access the audio recording on its website. The disclosure was signed by Jetkin Gudhka, Company Secretary & Compliance Officer.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Reports Strong Q1 FY26 Results with 25% Revenue Growth and 424% PAT Surge
News.Summary: Sharda Cropchem Limited reported quarterly results with total revenue increasing 25% to Rs. 985 crores compared to Rs. 785 crores in the previous year quarter. The agrochemical segment contributed 86% of total revenue at Rs. 846 crores, growing 25% year-on-year, while the non-agrochemical segment reached Rs. 139 crores, up 31%. Profit after tax surged 424% to Rs. 143 crores from Rs. 27 crores in the same quarter last year. EBITDA grew 67% to Rs. 142 crores with margins improving to 14.4%. Gross margins expanded 630 basis points to 35.5%. The company achieved volume growth of approximately 13% overall, with agrochemical volumes up 11.4% and non-agrochemical volumes rising 58.5%. Europe remained the largest market contributing 62% of agrochemical segment revenue. Working capital reduced by 18 days to 100 days. The company operates across 80+ countries with 525+ distributors and 500+ sales force personnel.

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Targets 15% Revenue Growth with EBITDA Margin of 15-18%

News.Title: Sharda Cropchem Reports Strong Q1 Performance with Net Profit Surge to 1.4B Rupees
